message_1: Let X be a topological space such that its closure is equal to its interior i.e. $\bar{X}=int(X)$. If X has 10 open sets, how many closed sets does X have?
message_2:
In a topological space, the number of closed sets is equal to the number of open sets. This is because there is a one-to-one correspondence between open sets and closed sets: the complement of an open set is a closed set, and the complement of a closed set is an open set.

Since X has 10 open sets, it also has 10 closed sets.
